item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Jean Cocteau
item.description: "I am a lie that always speaks the truth." -- Jean Cocteau

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The way of paradoxes is the way of truth. To test Reality we must see it on the tight-rope. When the Verities become acrobats we can judge them." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Jean Cocteau
item.description: "I love cats because I enjoy my home; and little by little, they become its visible soul." -- Jean Cocteau

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "I only go out to get me a fresh appetite for being alone." -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Jean Cocteau
item.description: "One of the characteristics of the dream is that nothing surprises us in it. With no regret, we agree to live in it with strangers, completely cut off from our habits and friends." -- Jean Cocteau

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Gaston Bachelard
item.description: "A special kind of beauty exists which is born in language, of language, and for language." -- Gaston Bachelard

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Jean Cocteau
item.description: "Mystery has its own mysteries, and there are gods above gods. We have ours, they have theirs. That is what's known as infinity." -- Jean Cocteau

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Napoleon
item.description: "What is history but a fable agreed upon?" -- Napoleon

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "If a man is gracious and courteous to strangers, it shows that he is a citizen of the world." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by James Burke
item.description: "If, as I've said all along, the universe at any time is what you say it is, then say." -- James Burke

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Vera Stanley Alder
item.description: "Limit love and you limit life." -- Vera Stanley Alder

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Charles Fort
item.description: "I conceive of nothing, in religion, science or philosophy, that is more than the proper thing to wear, for a while." -- Charles Fort

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Graham Hancock
item.description: "Human history has become too much a matter of dogma taught by 'professionals' in ivory towers as though it's all fact. Actually, much of human history is up for grabs. The further back you go, the more that the history that's taught in the schools and universities begins to look like some kind of faerie story." -- Graham Hancock

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Constantin Brâncuşi
item.description: "Create like a god. Command like a king. Work like a slave." -- Constantin Brâncuşi

item.title: Xanthippe add a quote by Constantin Brâncuşi
